metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4415 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in systemd. This security flaw can cause a localinformation leak due to systemd-coredump not respecting thefs.suid_dumpable kernel setting.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4415` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 245.4-4ubuntu3.20
libnss-mymachines - 245.4-4ubuntu3.20
libnss-resolve - 245.4-4ubuntu3.20
libnss-systemd - 245.4-4ubuntu3.20
libpam-systemd - 245.4-4ubuntu3.20
libsystemd0 - 245.4-4ubuntu3.20
libudev1 - 245.4-4ubuntu3.20
systemd - 245.4-4ubuntu3.20
systemd-container - 245.4-4ubuntu3.20
systemd-coredump - 245.4-4ubuntu3.20
systemd-journal-remote - 245.4-4ubuntu3.20
systemd-sysv - 245.4-4ubuntu3.20
systemd-tests - 245.4-4ubuntu3.20
systemd-timesyncd - 245.4-4ubuntu3.20
udev - 245.4-4ubuntu3.20
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '245.4-4ubuntu3.20').
